intro: Let's explore how heat moves! Imagine touching something hot – what happens to the heat?

questions.question: If you touch a hot stove and a cold metal railing, which one will transfer heat *to* your hand?
options: Both will transfer heat to your hand
Neither will transfer heat to your hand
questions.hint: Think about where heat likes to go! Does it go from cold to hot, or hot to cold?

questions.question: What do we call the movement of heat from a hotter object to a colder object?
questions.hint: This movement is a key idea we're learning about!

questions.question: When a hot object and a cold object are placed next to each other, heat will naturally move from:
options: The hot object to the cold object
The cold object to the hot object
There will be no movement of heat
Heat will move equally in both directions
questions.hint: Remember our analogy of water flowing downhill!

followups: Great job observing how heat moves!
Keep noticing how heat flows in your everyday life!
summary: Heat always flows from hotter things to colder things until they reach a similar temperature.
